instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CHGR_ACIN: What is CHGR_ACIN? CHGR_ACIN is a signal that is created by a voltage divider between the charger and ground that goes into the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip that creates PPBUS_G3H. It is necessary for SMC_BC_ACOK & CHGR_ACOK to be present so that the onewire circuit is told to turn on & allow the SMC to speak to the charger..
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R? This is a power rail between the battery and a current sense resistor before the battery power feeds current to the rest of the machine. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that it's not charging the battery.

I get 12.56V on F7040
12.56V on <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R</SIGNAL>

On U700 i get 4.6V in <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACIN</SIGNAL>

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
Do you get green light on Magsafe?
Did you test disconnecting BIL?

Post voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
Yes, I get green light and I disconected BIL.

Diode:
SCL = 0.528V
SDA = 0.525V

Voltage:
SCL = 3.4V
SDA = 3.4V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
Is the battery recognized at least?
Posy <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage with both charger and battery connected.

Did you try known good battery?
